items.title: Add disk number to  `slcli vs detail`
Add option to slcli vs list to show self-hosted vsis
items.body:
#1306 added ability to list virtual guests on hardware servers, which is great, but I think this feature should be hidden behind a flag, instead of default.

`slcli vs list --all` should list everything (current behavior )
`slcli vs list --hardware` should list all guests on hardware servers
`slcli vs list` should list only normal virtual guests


Also, update the table header from
`Hardware(id = 479564) guests associated `
to 
`Hostname.domain.com Guests`

items.title: slcli order preset-list has empty lines
Docs links need to be updated in the Block/File help section
items.body:
During a presentation about the Block and File Storage CLI and UI, two URLs caught my attention that were displayed as part of the SLCLI output. These should be updated to reflect the current domains of the product info and docs.

Old url -> new url
http://www.softlayer.com/block-storage -> https://www.ibm.com/cloud/block-storage
https://console.bluemix.net/docs/infrastructure/BlockStorage/index.html#provisioning -> https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/BlockStorage?topic=BlockStorage-getting-started#provisioning-considerations

### Expected Behavior
When you enter the command like `slcli block order-volume --help`, you should be presented with the usage information, options, and a link to the customer-facing documentation. The link should be pointing to the current IBM Cloud Docs URL.

### Actual Behavior
The link that is shared in the command output is the old bluemix one that was retired 2 years ago.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28069378/87982422-6667a980-ca9c-11ea-9cc0-d7d0f45701ed.png)

### Environment Information
SLCLI

items.title: Virtual Host Support
items.body:
Add support for getting information about Virtual Hosts and their guests.

1. `slcli hardware guests`
+ Add this command to get guest list from a hardware that is a virtual host.
2. `slcli vs list`
+ Add another table to list out guests that are on virtual hosts, if thats possible. Only show the table if there are guests on virtual hosts though.

items.title: slcli vs boot-mode
items.body:
Allow setting and getting a Virtual Guests boot mode.

Boot Mode should show up in `slcli vs detail`

Boot mode should be changeable in `slcli vs boot-mode <VSI ID> <TYPE>`

Steps to change boot mode:

1. Get the [getGuestBootParameter](https://sldn.softlayer.com/reference/services/SoftLayer_Virtual_Guest/getGuestBootParameter/)
2.  Get boot mode types from [SoftLayer_Virtual_Guest_Boot_Parameter_Type::getAllObjects](https://sldn.softlayer.com/reference/services/SoftLayer_Virtual_Guest_Boot_Parameter_Type/getAllObjects/)
3. Call [SoftLayer_Virtual_Guest_Boot_Parameter::editObject](https://sldn.softlayer.com/reference/services/SoftLayer_Virtual_Guest_Boot_Parameter/editObject/) using the ID from step 1

items.title: "iter" param should be allowed within manager's methods
items.body:
Hi guys,

I'm trying to use as much as I can the managers. Using the `order` manager gave me some hard time because of the `iter` parameter not usable via the `list_items()` method for example.

`list_items()` method only takes `filter` and `mask` as argument.

### My tests
```
return self.order.list_items(pkg_name, filter=filter, mask=mask)
```
Using the data returned by this method with Ansible return this error even if the returned value is a `dict`:
```
super(SoftLayerListResult, self).__init__(items)\nTypeError: 'NoneType' object is not iterable\n",
```

By using directly the `call()` method with `iter=True` Ansible is able to return the data from API.
```
return self.client.call("Product_Package", "getItems", id=pkg_id,
                        filter=filter, mask=mask, iter=True)
```

### Question

What will be the best way to have `iter` parameter usable with the manager's methods?

### Environment Information
Operating System: Fedora 31
softlayer-python version (`slcli --version`): v5.8.7

items.title: API should return 404 when resource is not found
items.body:
When trying to get a resource that doesn't exist the API should return a 404 and not `Internal Error`.
Using the `SOAP` or the `REST` API provide the same result.

### Expected Behavior

Proper return error/code.

### Actual Behavior

```
{
  "code": "SoftLayer_Exception_Public",
  "error": "Internal Error"
}
```

### Environment Information
Operating System: Fedora 31
softlayer-python version (`slcli --version`): 5.8.7
Python: 3.7.6

items.title: HW edit: Add redundancy flag for changing port speed
items.body:
#1068 

`slcli hw edit` should have an option to set the redundancy flag on https://sldn.softlayer.com/reference/services/SoftLayer_Hardware_Server/setPrivateNetworkInterfaceSpeed/ (and the public one)

add a flag for `--redundant/--degraded` that can only be used when setting public/private port speed.
If set, passes "redundant"/"degraded" to the setPrivateNetworkInterfaceSpeed API.

items.title: The call to API will ignore the offset when setting limit to 1
items.body:
We are trying to use SOAP API to get SoftLayer escalation tickets. We make the call to the service like following. 
```
client["Escalation"].call( "getAllObjects",
        filter={ #some filter options# },
        mask=MASK,  
        limit=1, offset=10000)
```
Since we need quite a large amount of data (a really long MASK), we have to set the limit to 1 otherwise we will receive errors like: `SoftLayer.exceptions.TransportError: TransportError(500): 500 Server Error: Internal Server Error for url: https://192.168.65.8/v3/internal/xmlrpc/SoftLayer_Escalation.`

### Expected Behavior
By setting limit to 1 and increase the offset, we hope to get the data record one by one.

### Actual Behavior
Actually, the API will ignore the offset and always return the first record matching the filtering options.

### Environment Information
Operating System: MacOS 10.15.4
softlayer-python version (`slcli --version`): 5.8.1

items.title: Snap version is over 1000 revisions old...suggest updating the snap.
items.body:
Let me know if you'd like any assistance updating the snap and which release is appropriate for "stable" release. 

Last stable release was NOV 2018, snap version: 383. Latest revision in "edge" which pulls from Git repo is 1422. These numbers do NOT match what the actual software version is; snaps use versions based on "builds". 

I can submit a PR but releasing a new "stable" version is pretty easy, depending on what you consider stable. 

@allmightyspiff and I have collaborated in the past as I built the original snap when working at SoftLayer.

items.title: Tag Management

so I think it would be good to add this to the CLI.

Rough idea of commands to write:

### slcli tags
- search  <tagName> 
    * show all tags with that name
- delete <tagName|id>
- list <all|attached|unattached>
- details <tagName|id>
    * Should show the tag, and anything with that tag.
- setTags <tags> <type> <objectId>
- types
- taggable <type>
    * list out all objects of Type that are taggable, somehow.

items.title: fix `slcli  lock replica-failback`
items.body:
BAD

```
$ slcli -v block replica-failback 41442919
Calling: SoftLayer_Network_Storage::failbackFromReplicant(id=41442919, mask='', filter='None', args=(None,), limit=None, offset=None))
```

GOOD
```
slcli -v  call-api SoftLayer_Network_Storage failbackFromReplicant --id=6548079
Calling: SoftLayer_Network_Storage::failbackFromReplicant(id=6548079, mask='', filter='{}', args=(), limit=None, offset=None))
```


[failbackFromReplicant](https://sldn.softlayer.com/reference/services/SoftLayer_Network_Storage/failbackFromReplicant/) doesn't accept parameters, so that needs to be changed in the manager.

[failoverToReplicant](https://sldn.softlayer.com/reference/services/SoftLayer_Network_Storage/failoverToReplicant/) doesn't take an `immediate` parameter either, which the manager is sending. So that hsould be fixed.

items.body:
```
$ slcli -v  vs dns-sync  77932517 --ptr
Calling: SoftLayer_Virtual_Guest::getObject(id=77932517, mask='mask[id,globalIdentifier,fullyQualifiedDomainName,hostname,domain,primaryBackendIpAddress,primaryIpAddress,primaryNetworkComponent[ id, primaryIpAddress, primaryVersion6IpAddressRecord[ipAddress] ]]', filter='None', args=(), limit=None, offset=None))

Attempt to update DNS records for testing.cgallo.com [y/N]: y
```

Also, lets take this time to implement a PTR record creator/editor to `slcli dns` and duplicate the vs dns-sync to `hw dns-sync`

error calling Billing_Item:
I am looking to download detailed billing information through API using Python. I am following this article - https://softlayer-api-python-client.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api/client/

But I get ('SOAP-ENV:Server', 'Internal Error') when I run the below give code snippet

Code snippet:
client = SoftLayer.Client(username=USERNAME, api_key=API_KEY)
accountService = client['SoftLayer_Account']
try: 
result = accountService.getAllBillingItems()
print(result)

except SoftLayer.SoftLayerAPIError as e:
print((e.faultCode, e.faultString))
exit(1)

### Expected Behavior
Returns list of billing item

### Actual Behavior:
Error ('SOAP-ENV:Server', 'Internal Error')

### Environment Information
Operating System: macOS Mojava version 10.14
softlayer-python version (`slcli --version`):SoftLayer version is 5.7.0

items.title: Cannot order a HA gateway with slcli order place
items.body:
A HA gateway requires 2 `hardware` objects and the quantity must be 2 so I tried by adding `"quantity": 2` in the `--extras` parameter but I got a `MismatchedQuantity` exception

### Actual Behavior
`slcli order place --billing monthly VIRTUAL_ROUTER_APPLIANCE_1_GPBS DALLAS05 INTEL_INTEL_XEON_E31270_V6_3_80 OS_JUNIPER_VSRX_15_X_UP_TO_1GBPS_STANDARD RAM_32_GB_DDR4_2133_ECC_NON_REG DISK_CONTROLLER_RAID HARD_DRIVE_3_00TB_SATA_III SRIOV_ENABLED BANDWIDTH_5000_GB MONITORING_HOST_PING 1_GBPS_REDUNDANT_PUBLIC_PRIVATE_NETWORK_UPLINKS REBOOT_KVM_OVER_IP 1_IP_ADDRESS NOTIFICATION_EMAIL_AND_TICKET AUTOMATED_NOTIFICATION UNLIMITED_SSL_VPN_USERS_1_PPTP_VPN_USER_PER_ACCOUNT NESSUS_VULNERABILITY_ASSESSMENT_REPORTING --complex-type SoftLayer_Container_Product_Order_Hardware_Server_Gateway_Appliance --extras '{"hardware":[{"hostname":"gateway01","domain":"example.com"},{"hostname":"gateway02","domain":"example.com"}],"quantity":2}'
`
```
This action will incur charges on your account. Continue? [y/N]: y
SoftLayerAPIError(SoftLayer_Exception_Order_MismatchedQuantity): The number of servers (2) does not match the order quantity (1).
```
### Expected
I think there could be an option called `--quantity` so the user could order more than 1 device with same specs and would also fix this

### Environment Information
softlayer-python version (`slcli --version`): 5.7.1

items.title: CLI event-log updates
items.body:
See comments on #1099 for context.

* `slcli event-log get` should support limits, and iterations
* `slcli sg event-log ` should support looking up ruleIds instead of request ids i think. I don't think looking up the requestId is very natural for a user
* Add pagination to the event-log manager for getAllObjects
* Add support for custom limits to event-log manager. Should be able to request X amount of logs.
* Add read-the-docs style documentation for event-log stuff

items.title: Cannot create vsi on dedicated host after the fix #676
items.body:
It seems there is no way to create a vsi on a dedicated host, this is an issue in the fix #676 where `placeOrder` is used in the place of  ` createObject` method.

```
$ slcli vs create -H test01 -D tscupprt.com --host-id 1101 -d mex01 -o UBUNTU_LATEST -c 4 -m 16
This action will incur charges on your account. Continue? [y/N]: y

SoftLayerAPIError(SoftLayer_Exception_Order_Item_Invalid): Invalid price 4 x 2.0 GHz or higher Cores (Dedicated Host) (200313) provided on the order container. Please select a dedicated instance Computing Instance price to order a dedicated instance.
```

The same command works with latest version 5.6.4

These kind of vsi cannot be created through flavors, it is required to select a hostId, cpu and memory.

**Expected Result:**
It should be possible to create vsi on dedicated host by selecting at least a  `--host-id`  , `--cpu`, and `--memory`

items.title: Exception during `slcli file volume-cancel --immediate`
items.body:
I _think_ this is ~a recurrence of~ related to https://github.com/softlayer/softlayer-python/issues/880.

I have an IBM Kubernetes Service cluster in which I had allocated a collection of persistent volumes that were mapped to SoftLayer volumes.

When the Kubernetes persistent volumes were deleted the SoftLayer volumes were not - so I ran the following `slcli` command to request an immediate `file volume-cancel`.

```console
slcli --format json file volume-list --columns notes,id | jq --raw-output '.[] | select(.notes != null) | select(.notes | contains("<my-kubernetes-namespace>")) | .id' | xargs -n1 slcli -y file volume-cancel --immediate
```
*_I understand this isn't the ideal technique for cleaning lingering volumes._

### Expected Behavior

A message on the console reporting that the `volume-cancel` request had been serviced.

### Actual Behavior

Stack trace similar to the following:

```console
An unexpected error has occured:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/SoftLayer/CLI/core.py", line 182, in main
    cli.main(**kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 717, in main
    rv = self.invoke(ctx)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1137, in invoke
    return _process_result(sub_ctx.command.invoke(sub_ctx))
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1137, in invoke
    return _process_result(sub_ctx.command.invoke(sub_ctx))
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 956, in invoke
    return ctx.invoke(self.callback, **ctx.params)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 555, in invoke
    return callback(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/decorators.py", line 64, in new_func
    return ctx.invoke(f, obj, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 555, in invoke
    return callback(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/SoftLayer/CLI/file/cancel.py", line 29, in cli
    reason, immediate)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/SoftLayer/managers/file.py", line 485, in cancel_file_volume
    billing_item_id = file_volume['billingItem']['id']
KeyError: 'billingItem'

Feel free to report this error as it is likely a bug:

The following snippet should be able to reproduce the error
```

items.title: placement group support
items.body:
CLI Support for Placement Groups

The recent release of Placement Groups is supported in the console UI and in the API. However, as a way to improve the ease-of-use, and to support one of our most important clients for this feature, Macy's, we also want to support PGs via the CLI.

This should include all actions available in the API for Placement Groups and the associated fields for VSIs. User stories include:

 * Create a new Placement Group
 * Delete an empty Placement Group
 *  Assign a new VSI into an existing Placement Group on provision
 *  Remove a VSI from a PG only by deleting it
 *  Return a list of Placement Groups
 *  Return a VSI's Placement Group in its device details

https://console.test.cloud.ibm.com/docs/vsi/vsi_placegroup.html#placement-groups
API Documentation: https://softlayer.github.io/reference/services/SoftLayer_Virtual_PlacementGroup/

items.title: update Requests Library >=2.20.0
items.body:
https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-18074
>CVE-2018-18074 More information
moderate severity
Vulnerable versions: <= 2.19.1
Patched version: 2.20.0
The Requests package through 2.19.1 before 2018-09-14 for Python sends an HTTP Authorization header to an http URI upon receiving a same-hostname https-to-http redirect, which makes it easier for remote attackers to discover credentials by sniffing the network.
